Speaker: voice
Dialogue: In 1988, the crime rate in the United States rises four hundred percent.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: The once-great city of New York becomes the one maximum-security prison for the entire country.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: A fifty-foot containment wall is erected along the New Jersey shoreline, across the Harlem river, and down along the Brooklyn shoreline.  It completely surrounds Manhattan Island.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: All bridges and waterways are mined.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: The United States Police Force, like an army, is encamped around the island.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: There are no guards inside the prison: only prisoners and the worlds they have made.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: The rules are simple.  Once you go in, you don't come out.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: This is Gotham 4, North Bay, Station 17.  I have an escape in progress. An object in mid-bay moving toward the wall.

Speaker: helicopter pilot
Dialogue: You have 10 seconds.  Turn around.  Start back to the island.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: Security, this is Rehme.  We have confirmation from Gotham 4.  We have a kill in midharbor.  South of the battery.  Two in the water dead.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Attention.  You are now entering the debarkation area.  No talking.  No smoking.   The next scheduled departure to the prison is in two hours. You now have the option to terminate and be cremated on the premises. If you elect this option, notify the duty sergeant in your processing area.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: We've got a small jet in trouble, over restricted air space.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: We've been on the board for the last twenty minutes.  We haven't been able to reach them.  There was a transmission ten minutes ago.  He

Speaker: controller
Dialogue: David 14, acknowledge.  David 14, we are sending Air Rescue.  Squawk 7700, contact on 121.5.  Bayonne.  I have a mayday in restricted space.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: There's no David 14 on the computer.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: Unregistered code.  We telexed Washington.  Still waiting for a reply.

Speaker: controller
Dialogue: I think I've got him, sir.

Speaker: rebel voice
Dialogue: It's too late, assholes.  All your imperialist weapons and lies can't save him now.  We're going down.  We're going to crash.

Speaker: rebel
Dialogue: Tell this to the workers when they ask where your leader went . . .

Speaker: rebel
Dialogue: We, the soldiers of the national liberation front of America, in the name of the workers and all the oppressed of this imperialist country have struck a fatal blow to the racist police stick!

Speaker: rebel
Dialogue: What better revolutionary example than to let the president perish in the inhuman dungeon of his own imperialist prison?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Can't you shoot off the lock?

Speaker: agent
Dialogue: No, sir, she's pressurized the cabin.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: How about lifting the door off of the hinges?

Speaker: expert
Dialogue: Sir, this is a locating device to trace you if you become separated from the pod.  I'm activating it now.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: God save me and watch over you all.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Computer simulation tracking Air Force One.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: 1-W-Larry.  Over the battery.  We're moving down.  Direct sight ahead.

Speaker: weirdo
Dialogue: You touch me... he dies.  If you're not in the air in thirty seconds... he dies.  You come back in... he dies.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: Yes, he's right here, Mr. Vice President.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: This is Bob Hauk.  ...We can't.  If we move in with choppers, they'll kill him.  We're lucky if he's not dead already... They don't want anything yet.  By the time they figure out what they want, it'll be too late.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: Tell him we have to go with your plan now.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: We can't wait until tomorrow.  If we have to move in and take the island, it's a last resort.  It's 8:45.  I want permission to try a rescue.  Thank you.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: S.D. Plissken.  American Lieutenant.  Special Forces Unit, Black Flight. Two Purple Hearts, Leningrad and Siberia.  Youngest man to be decorated by the President.  You robbed the federal reserve depository.  Life sentence, New York Maximum Security Penitentiary. I'm ready to kick your ass out of the world, War Hero.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Special Forces Unit.  Texas Thunder.  We heard of you, too, Plissken.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: I have a deal for you.  You'll receive full pardon for every criminal act committed in the United States.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: There was an accident about an hour ago.  A small jet went down inside New York City.  The President was on board.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: That's not funny, Plissken.    You go in, find the President and bring him out in 24 hours, and you're a free man.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: No time.  Give me an answer.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: We're still at war, Plissken.  We need him alive.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I don't give a fuck about your war... or your president.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: You flew the Gullfire over Leningrad.  You know how to get in quiet. You're all I've got.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I guess I go in one way or the other.  Doesn't mean shit to me.  Give me the paper.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: I told you I wasn't a fool, Plissken.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: Some of them have cars.  They took old junkers that were left behind and converted them to steam.  We think they may also have a gasoline source in there, and power.  Greenhouses, rigged up generators.  Some areas have streetlights. The crazies.  Live in the subways.  Complete control of the underground.  They're night raiders.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Tracer.  Sends a radio signal for fifteen minutes.  You push it, we can track you on radar.  Just like Leningrad.  But they added something.  A safety catch.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Top of the world trade center.  Only place you can land.  They won't see it, and you can take off from a free fall.  On the roof there's a service elevator.  It's still operational.  We use it to infiltrate the prison.  There's a power box.  It'll activate the elevator down to fifty.  From there on down you walk.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: You can locate the President by his vital signs bracelet, on his wrist. It sends out a sig pulse.  Use this.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Homing device.  Shows directions and distance.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Strong antitoxin.  Stops bacteria and viral-proofs you for 24 hours.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Twenty-two hours, twenty-nine minutes, fifty-seven seconds...

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: In twenty-two hours the Hartford Summit meeting will be over.  China and the Soviet Union will go back home.  The president was on his way to the summit when his plane went down.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: He has a briefcase attached to his wrist.  The tape recording inside has to reach Hartford in 22 hours.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: You know anything about nuclear fusion?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: It's about the survival of the human race, Plissken.  Something you don't give a shit about.

Speaker: medic
Dialogue: I'm going to inject you.  It'll sting for a second or two...

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: That idea you had about turning the Gullfire around 180 degrees and flying off to Canada.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: What did you do to me, asshole?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: My idea, Plissken.  Something we've been fooling around with.  Two microscopic capsules lodged in your arteries.  They're already starting to dissolve.  In twenty-two hours, the cores will completely dissolve. Inside the cores are that heat-sensitive charge.  Not a large explosive. About the size of a pinhead.  Just big enough to --  open up both your arteries.  I'd say you'd be dead in ten or fifteen seconds --

Speaker: medic
Dialogue: They're protected by the cores.  Fifteen minutes before the last hour is up we can neutralize the charge with X-rays.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: We'll burn out the charges IF you have the President.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: What if I'm a little late?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: No more Hartford Summit.  And no more Snake Plissken.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: When I get back I'm going to kill you.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Suppose he's dead, Hauk.  If I come back without him, you'll burn these things out?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Remember, once inside you're on your own.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Oh, you mean I can't count on you?

Speaker: computer
Dialogue: Tracer test confirmed at 20 hours, 17 minutes, 30 seconds.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Are you picking up the target blip?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Plissken?  Plissken?  Plissken, what are you doing?

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Playing with myself.  I'm going in.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I'm inside the World Trade Center on the 50th floor.  Just like Leningrad, Hauk.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Yeah, but taking off is for shit.  I'll work it out.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: You'll have to use the east stairwell.  It'll take you a little while to get to ground level.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Call me when you get outside.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I'm at the plane.  Nobody else made it, Hauk.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I've got his pulse.  Right up ahead, moving northwest.

Speaker: actors
Dialogue: This is hell!  This is hate!

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Hey!  You're Snake Plissken, ain't you?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Hey!  You don't want to walk around down there, Snake!

Speaker: bum
Dialogue: Hi, Chief.  Nice night.  Nice boots.  Niiiiice boots.  Hey.

Speaker: bum
Dialogue: Easy now, chief.  I'm walking.  I'm walking.

Speaker: drunk
Dialogue: I'm the President?  Sure, I'm the President.  If I knew where I got this thing --  I'd be the President.

Speaker: drunk
Dialogue: I woke up, and there it was, just like a miracle . . .

Speaker: medic
Dialogue: It . . . It may be just an impact on the mechanism itself . . .

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I don't know who you assholes are looking at, but it's NOT the President.

Speaker: drunk
Dialogue: Hail to the chief . . . La la la la la la . . .

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: All right, get your machine ready.  I'm coming out.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Listen to me, Hauk.  The President is DEAD, you got that?  Somebody's had him for dinner!

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Plissken, if you get back in that glider I'll shoot you down.  You climb out, I'll burn you off the wall.  You understand that, Plissken?

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: A plane crashed seven hours ago.  Did you see it?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Bad neighborhood, Snake!  You don't want to be walking from the Bowery to 42nd street at night!  I've been driving a cab here for 30 years and I'm telling you, you don't walk around here at night!  Yes, sir! They'll kill you and strip you in ten seconds flat.  Usually I'm not down around here myself, but I wanted to catch that show.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: This stuff is like gold around here, you know.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Hey, Snake, when'd you get in?  I didn't even know they caught you.  Ohhh, Snake Plissken in my cab.  Wait'll I tell Eddie!  Hey, hang on, Snake.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Hey, what were you doing back there, Snake?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Well, why didn't you ask me?  Hell, I know everybody in this town.  Yes, sir.  I've been driving this cab for thirty years, this very same cab.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I'm GONNA ask you.  Now where's the President?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: The Duke's got him!  Everyone knows the Duke's got him!  You don't have to put a gun to my head.  I'll tell you!

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: The DUKE!  The Duke of New York!  A-Number-1!  The big man, that's who!

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I want to meet this Duke.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: You can't meet the Duke, are you crazy?  Nobody wants to meet the Duke! You meet him once and then you're dead!

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: I hate to leave her on the street.  Usually I don't leave her alone at all.  But you're a special case, Snake.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: It's OK, Snake.  It's a better neighborhood.  You can relax.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Boy, they got a great place here.  Like a fortress!

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Somebody wants to see Brain, it's important --

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I want to meet the Duke.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Hey, what do you think of this place, Snake?  It used to be a public library.  Oh, that Brain, he's the greatest!  Mr. Fabulous!  Duke loves him.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: That's Maggie.  Brain's squeeze.  The Duke gave him to Brain just to keep him happy . . . see what I mean?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Brain?  Brain!  I brought somebody to see you!

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Where you been, Harold?  It's been a long time.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: You never told me you knew Snake Plissken, Brain.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Isn't that great?  Hey, Brain, I could use some gas if you can spare some . . .

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: I'm glad you remember me.  Yeah.  A man should remember his past. Kansas City, four years ago.  You ran out on me.  You left me sitting there.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: We were buddies, Harold.  You, me, and Fresno Bob.  You know what they did to Bob?

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: You want to see him sprayed all over that map, baby?  Where's the President?!

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Swear to god, Snake, I don't know --

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Why do you want to know?

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Working for the man now, huh?

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Then I'll just beat it out of your squeeze --

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Mm-hm.  Maggie doesn't know EXACTLY where he is and unless you know EXACTLY PRECISELY where he is you'll never find him.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Listen, I'll take you out of here.  Yeah.  Jet glider just a couple of blocks down the street.  And all you gotta do is get me to him.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: No kidding?  On the level?  Will you take me, too?

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: We've got to deal somewhere else.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: We've got the President.  And the Duke's taking everybody out of here.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Never happen.  See, I know something you and the Duke don't know.  We've only got so long before Mr. President don't mean a whole lot.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I know him!  Look at his face, he's lying!

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Right, Harold.  I'm lying.  So I might as well have some fun and keep looking by myself.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Brain, he'll kill us both if you don't tell him --

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Brain, you've got to tell him!

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Brain, you've got to tell him --

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Tell him, tell him, tell him --

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Just one thing right now.  Don't call me "Harold."

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: So you work for this Duke, huh?

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Yeah.  Make gas for him.  Figure out things for him.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Like how to get across the 69th street bridge -- it's mined, but I know where they're planted.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: We got a diagram from a guy that got all the way across . . . before they shot the poor bastard.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: We got a crew up there now clearing the way across the first barricade.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: What a sight, Snake!  The whole camp rolling right across the bridge and the President right out front!  Oh, that would have been so fine . . .

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Yeah, but we're going with Snake now.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: That's the Duke!  I know the sound of his engines.  Don't cross the Duke -- everybody knows that.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: He wants my diagram of the bridge.  When he finds out I'm with you he's going to want my life!  Shit, Plissken, I knew I shouldn't have listened to you --

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: We've got to get to the President NOW, while he's busy.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Forget it, he's on the other side of town and we got no wheels.  The deal is off --

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I think they saw us!  Turn left, turn left here!

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I know, I know, the Duke'll take Seventh Avenue, Broadway is five minutes --

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: He'll be in the third car from the end, by the last campfire.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: It's all right.  He's got to go in the front way.  It'll take him five minutes.  If you're not back to the car in four minutes you're on your own.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: When we get there, Harold, you just keep talking.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Hi, guys.  Hi . . . how's it going?  Cooled off a little, huh?

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Duke told us to wait inside.  He's on his way here now.

Speaker: head dude
Dialogue: He didn't say nothing to us about it.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Well, you can't expect him to tell everybody in the joint, now can you? That's why he's the Duke.

Speaker: head dude
Dialogue: Why don't we wait outside here for him?

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Why don't we wait inside for him?

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: What are your specific orders, by the way?

Speaker: head dude
Dialogue: Specific orders, Brain, was for me not to let no one go inside.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: How's the President holding up, by the way?  Any political discussion you've had with him?

Speaker: second guard
Dialogue: That Brain is a real pain in the ass.  He's always sniffing around like a dog.

Speaker: first guard
Dialogue: He comes up with the gas.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Hauk sent me.  We've got to move fast.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Move fast?  You're goddamned right I'll move fast.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: They got him.  Now watch him.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: He had a gun on me, Duke, there was nothing I could do.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Snake Plissken, Duke.  The Man sent him in here.  Something's going down . . . we need him.

Speaker: duke
Dialogue: Snaaaaaake Plissken.  I've heard of you.

Speaker: surveillance 4
Dialogue: This is surveillance 4 to security control.  Nothing on the infrared body scan.  Nothing in the searchlight. There aren't any fires on the street.  Nobody moving down here.

Speaker: surveillance 5
Dialogue: Surveillance 5 . . . security control . . . negative on infrared body scan . . . no movement in the searchlight . . . nothing strange going on down there.

Speaker: vice president
Dialogue: We've got to go in now.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: This is my prison, I'll give the orders.

Speaker: surveillance 4
Dialogue: This is Surveillance 4 to Security Control.  Nothing on the infrared body scan.  Negative on the sweep.

Speaker: surveillance 4
Dialogue: This is Surveillance 4 to Security Control.  Nothing on the infrared body scan.  Negative...

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Oh. It's at my place, Duke.  Duke, that Plissken said something about a time limit.

Speaker: duke
Dialogue: That's a lot of crap.  What did I teach you?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: You... You are... the Duke of New... New York... You're... A-Number-One.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: YOU ARE... THE DUKE OF NEW YORK... YOU'RE A-NUMBER-ONE!

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Duke... Don't kill Plissken.  We need him.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: People out below in the park.  Can you see them?

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Surveillance 2 to Security Control.  We're getting that readout, mostly in the infrared.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: We have a visual sighting on it.  It's a crowd of prisoners in Central Park.  They're waving at us.  Signaling us in the food drop area. They're waving us down.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I still can't figure out whether that son of a bitch Plissken was telling the truth or not.  God, I hate that guy.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, but how?  You gotta land the glider and take off.  Someplace high up.  World Trade Center.  That's it.  There we go.  The World Trade Center.  And it's gonna be a hell of a lot easier for me to take off than it was for him to land.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: "Amnesty for all prisoners in New York City in exchange for President. 69th Street Bridge tomorrow, 12 Noon.  No bullshit or he's dead."

Speaker: vice president
Dialogue: So much for your man, Hauk?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Warm up the choppers.  We're moving in.

Speaker: duke
Dialogue: They sent in their best man.  And when we roll down the 69th street bridge tomorrow on our way to freedom, we're gonna have their best man leading the way.  From the neck up.

Speaker: duke
Dialogue: On the hood of my car!

Speaker: weirdo
Dialogue: What are you so nervous about?

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I'm here to see the President.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Well... I'll have to tell him you said that.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: He's got something hidden in his clothing.  The Duke wants it.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Cyanide capsules.  The Duke don't want a dead president.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Yeah.  He might try to take it tomorrow.

Speaker: weirdo
Dialogue: That's bullshit.  You're not supposed to be in here, Brain --

Speaker: computer
Dialogue: Tracer activated at one hour, thirty-five minutes, twenty-seven seconds.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Get on the radio!  Keep them down!  Nobody move!

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: He's approaching the World Trade Center.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: I knew that son of a bitch was alive.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: The signal only lasts for 15 minutes.  Download the choppers.  We're in a standby situation.

Speaker: vice president
Dialogue: Anybody could have pushed that button.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Only Plissken knew there was a safety catch.  Now we'll give him a little more time, just to make sure.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Goddamned redskins!  They're savages, Mr. President!

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Listen, Snake, I swear to god, I thought you were dead --

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: That's your car in the lobby?  The keys!  Quick!  Quick!  Diagram of the bridge!  Hey, hey, hey --

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I'm the only one who knows how to read that, Snake --

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Stay out of my way, Harold.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Besides, you can't read and drive at the same time.  You need us!

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: You shouldn't have double-crossed me again, Brain.  Come on, let's go --

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Swear to god, Snake, I know where it is.  Just take us to the car and I'll take you right to it.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Come on, come on, we're wasting time!

Speaker: duke
Dialogue: This whole deal of yours is over, Snake.  You and Brain just say good- bye to each other.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: They come in groups of threes!

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: You traded away your hat for it!

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: You've got to slow down a little, Snake...

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I think there are three mines ahead, Snake.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Stay left, stay left, stay left, and then jog right when I tell you.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: You're pushing her too hard, Snake.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: I said JOG RIGHT!... you asshole.

Speaker: brain
Dialogue: Stay to the right, stay to the right, now jog left.  Hold it, left... left... LEFT, DAMMIT!

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: Station 19!  They spotted two cars on the 69th street bridge.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: Taxicab and a Cadillac.  Taxi hit a mine.  There's four people on foot.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Get a jeep with a winch over there fast.

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: Strombaerden!  Get over to Station 19.  They're coming across the bridge.

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: This is Rehme, Security Control.  We are in a standby situation. Repeat.  We are in a standby situation.  All helicopters, down.  Wall guard, do not fire on prisoners.  Repeat, do not fire on prisoners.  All vehicles, stand by.  Repeat, stand by.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Yeah, hey, Number One!  You're the Duke!  You're the Duke!

Speaker: rehme
Dialogue: I radioed ahead, Mr. President.  They know the situation.  They're waiting for your broadcast.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I, uh... I want to thank you.  Anything you want... you just name it.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Just a moment of your time.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: We did get you out.  A lot of people died in the process.  I just wondered how you felt about it.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I want to thank them.  This nation appreciates their sacrifice.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Look, uh, I'm on the air in...  Two and a half minutes?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: You going to kill me now, Snake?

Speaker: hauk
Dialogue: I've got another deal for you.  I want you to think it over while you're resting.  I want to give you a job.  We'd make one hell of a team, Snake.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Good evening.  Although I shall not be present at this historic summit meeting, I present this, in the hope that our great nations may learn to live in peace.
